channel.title: Documentation on Pionia
channel.description: Recent content in Documentation on Pionia

item.title: Introduction
item.description: About Welcome to the official documentation of pionia - /ˌpʌɪəˈnɪə/ framework.

item.title: Why Pionia?
item.description: Pionia was developed to make it easy for developers to build high-performance REST applications removing the unnecessary complexities that come with most common traditional frameworks.

item.title: Application Structure
item.description: Taking our directory structure from the API Tutorial we created here.

item.title: API Tutorial
item.description: This section assumes that you have already setup your pinia framework project.

item.title: Services
item.description: Some actions like list, delete, create, retrieve/details, random, updated, are provided by default. You can still add more actions as you see fit.

item.title: Generic Services
item.description: All business logic in Pionia is stored in services. This guide will show you how to create, protect and use services in Pionia.

item.title: Security - Authentication and Authorization
item.description: Authentication and Authorization are two important aspects of security in any application. This guide will show you how to secure your application using pionia.

item.title: Logging in Pionia
item.description: As a developer, you need to log information about the application’s state, errors, and other important information. This guide will show you how to log in pionia.
